description._content: Image taken from: Title: "Key to the Geology of the Globe. An essay, designed to show that the present geographical, hydrographical, and geological structures observed on the Earth's crust, were the result of forces acting according to fixed, demonstrable laws, analogous to those governing the development of organic bodies ... Illustrated by maps and diagrams" Author: OWEN, Richard - Professor of Geology and Chemistry in the University of Nashville Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 7105.c.20." Page: 10 Place of Publishing: Nashville, Tenn Date of Publishing: 1857 Publisher: Stevenson & Owen Issuance: monographic Identifier: 002737183 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
